title: What I Learned Dogsitting for New York City’s Opulent Elite
text: In a city of yawning class inequality, some side hustles let you glimpse how the other half lives.

title: The Virtual Vet Will See You Meow
text: Veterinary telemedicine could help more pet owners access much-needed care and put anxious animals at ease, but challenges remain.

title: Help! My Dog Was Rejected by the Airline Because of a Carrier Rule That Doesn’t Exist.
text: A gate agent suddenly objected to a canine who’d flown previously on the same route, saying the carrier wasn’t big enough. Our columnist tries to sort out what the actual rules for pets on planes are.

title: On Pets, Moral Logic and Love
text: I didn’t think I was a dog person. Then Herbie showed up and taught me a lesson about love.

title: When Helpless Fish Need a Hero, She Answers the Call
text: Three hundred goldfish in a hospital basement, a suckermouth at the airport: When fish are in crisis, a Bronx beautician and a partner in Pennsylvania ride to the rescue.

title: 3 Dogs Die After Eating Poisoned Meatballs at a Race in France
text: The poisonings took place at the French canicross championships, in which people run or cycle while attached to their dogs.

title: Our Relatives Keep Bringing Their Dog Over. How Can We Stop Them?
text: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on how to tell loved ones that you don’t love their pet.

title: How a Trade Changed Everything for Two N.B.A. Players and Their Dogs
text: Professional sports can be a tough business. When Mikal Bridges was dealt from the Suns to the Nets, his friend Cam Payne had to give the news to Sonny and Uno.

title: For Ukraine’s Animals, a Home Is Getting Harder to Find
text: Early in the war, thousands of pets were ferried out of danger, mostly to other European countries. But now adoptions are waning.

title: How One Ukrainian Company Survived, and Thrived, Through a Year of War
text: For Kormotech and its 1,300 employees, Russia’s invasion disrupted everything. After nimble decision-making and good fortune, sales are up, providing Ukraine with much-needed tax revenue.

title: Nausea, Wobbling, Confusion: Dogs Are Getting Sick From Discarded Weed
text: In places where recreational use is legal, dogs are getting sick from eating the remains of joints and other cannabis products, veterinarians and poison-control centers say.

title: George Santos, Puppies and Bad Checks: How a Theft Charge Got Expunged
text: Mr. Santos was able to get a criminal theft charge in Pennsylvania dismissed, after he told the police that someone had stolen his checkbook.

title: About Those 2,500 Dogs That George Santos Claims He Saved
text: Several people questioned the way Mr. Santos’s charity, Friends of Pets United, handled funds that were raised to benefit the animals.

title: Sorry, Dogs: The Lobby Is Off-Limits.
text: The four-legged pets are welcome, but not welcome everywhere. Their owners must carry them or use a service elevator.

title: How These Dog Walkers Make Over $100,000 a Year
text: It’s all those pandemic puppies.

title: What, Your Dog Doesn’t Have Her Own Refrigerator?
text: Interior design that caters to animals has become its own niche market with the great pandemic pet boom.

title: ‘Dog Gone’ Review: He Let the Dog Out
text: In this Netflix family movie, based on a true story, a yellow Lab disappears on the Appalachian Trail, and Rob Lowe is tasked with finding him.

title: Men’s Wear Puts on the Dog
text: A pavilion dedicated to the multibillion-dollar market in pet apparel makes its debut at the world’s largest men’s wear trade show.

title: A New England Town Invaded by Coyotes Calls in the Sharpshooters
text: Compact, densely populated and surrounded by water, Nahant (and its small dogs) are on edge. It’s the first Massachusetts municipality to ask the government to kill problem animals.

title: New York Bans Pet Stores From Selling Dogs, Cats and Rabbits
text: The ban, which takes effect in December 2024, is meant to prevent the sale of animals raised by commercial breeders accused of keeping them in inhumane conditions.

title: Who Is Rep.-Elect George Santos? His Résumé May Be Largely Fiction.
text: Mr. Santos, a Republican from New York, says he’s the “embodiment of the American dream.” But he seems to have misrepresented a number of his career highlights.

title: The Days of Doggies in the Window Are Numbered
text: New York State is banning pet shops from selling dogs, cats and rabbits, starting in 2024, in an effort to crack down on “puppy mills.”

title: What Do Stray Dogs Tell Us About the South?
text: A film about dogs conveys the complex reality behind the stories of neglect.

title: Jewelry Featuring Your Pet: ‘A Forever Thing’
text: Artists capture dogs, cats and other beloved animals in forms ranging from gold charms to crystal intaglios.

title: My Duduś
text: A filmmaker documents his mother’s bond with an abandoned baby squirrel.

title: My Mother Has Two Sons: Me and a Squirrel
text: A space is filled after an only child leaves the nest.

title: Day 5: How to Give a Rescue Animal as a Gift
text: Before tying a red bow on a puppy, here are a few things to consider.

title: Puppies on Prozac: How to Handle Your Pet’s Anxiety
text: Veterinarians say they have seen an increasing number of pets experiencing mental distress. Here’s how to spot the signs.

title: Was the Pandemic Dog Boom a Myth?
text: Is New York City really overrun by barking hounds? The data might tell a different story.

title: The Guilt of Putting Down Your Pet
text: Readers describe the decisions at the end of their pet’s lives. Also: A.I. in the courts; book bans; Africa’s elephants; math and beauty.

title: How to Evacuate With Pets
text: Owners should make every attempt not to leave their pets behind, animal advocates say. You can avoid the worst by planning ahead.

title: What Is ‘Dogfooding’?
text: The practice in which tech workers use their own product consistently to see how well it works and where improvements can be made.

title: ‘DC League of Super-Pets’ Review: #ReleaseTheLassieCut
text: Dwayne Johnson and Kevin Hart voice canine heroes in a family-friendly animated spinoff of the “Justice League” franchise.

title: The Diet Worked For Them. Now Their Pets Are on It.
text: Paleo, vegan, gluten-free: Owners are putting animals on human regimens and fueling a huge pet-wellness industry. But some health experts are concerned.

title: Pet Dogs and Cats
text: Erica Hsiung Wojcik opens our solving weekend.

title: Your Cat Might Not Be Ignoring You When You Speak
text: Cats have a reputation for being aloof, but a new study has found that their relationships with their owners may be stronger than we thought.

title: How to Take Your Pet Along for the Ride (or Flight)
text: As travel returns for humans, more of them want to take their animal companions with them on vacation. Here, tips on making that experience a happy one for everyone.

title: Vocabulary in Context: Exotic Pets
text: Test your vocabulary and reading comprehension with this quiz based on the Times article "The Internet’s Exotic Pets, and the People Who Love Them."

title: The Perils of Working on a C.E.O.’s Pet Project
text: Big tech companies have long been willing to fund efforts with no obvious payoff. But those groups have been hit hard in recent layoffs.

title: Vaccine Hesitancy Comes for Pet Parents
text: Some pet owners have extended vaccine worries to their furry pals. When is it appropriate to skip a dog or cat’s shot, and when is it absolutely crucial?

title: Would Your Pet Make a Good Therapy Animal?
text: Shy animals are probably ill suited for the job.

title: The Great Guinea Pig Giveaway Has Begun
text: From geckos to chinchillas, small pets were a pandemic balm. Now shelters across the country say they are being surrendered.

title: Pets Have Put On Pandemic Weight, Too
text: Humans weren't the only ones who gained weight during lockdown.

title: What Do You Think of Pet Weddings?
text: The events have recently become more popular. Why do you think that is? Would you attend or even host one?

title: Pope Scolds Couples Who Choose Pets Over Kids
text: Expressing concern about global birthrates, Francis said such couples were acting in a selfish way that diminished humanity.

title: The World Is on Fire, and the Pope Is Troubled by Your Pet
text: On Fido and fruitfulness.

title: The South End of Stamford, Conn.: Master-Planned With Luxury Rentals, and Lots of Pets
text: The neighborhood, a 322-acre peninsula on Long Island Sound, has been redeveloped with 4,000 new apartments. And there are more to come.

title: How to Block Fireworks Noise for Adults, Kids, and Pets
text: Ooh-ing and ahh-ing over fireworks is an American tradition, but for some people (and pets), the booms and bangs can be a troubling source of fear and anxiety. Noise from fireworks can reach levels as high as 120 to 170 decibels. That’s louder than the sound of a jackhammer or a jet plane taking off...

title: Love Letter: A New Boyfriend or a New Dog?
text: After a divorce, which would you choose?

title: Ukrainian refugees find shelter, and a hearty welcome for their pets, in Romania.
text: Viktor and Rachel Borovic had only two hours to prepare to flee their city. But they were clear about what was important to them.

title: Rabbits Are Boring Pets. I Love Them Anyway.
text: My friends and family don’t get it. All I can do is try to describe what it’s like to be with them, the moments I’m not sure I can do without.

title: Elmo’s Unhinged Rant About a Pet Rock Resonates With the Exasperated
text: A 2004 clip from “Sesame Street” surfaced on social media this week, drawing thousands of responses from viewers expressing that they could relate to Elmo’s sense of frustration.

title: No More Pet Store Puppies? New York May Finally Ban Sales.
text: A bill prohibiting the sale of dogs, cats and rabbits in New York pet stores, passed by the Legislature in June, awaits a decision from Gov. Kathy Hochul.

title: Flight Attendants in the Pandemic and Wellness Diets for Pets: The Week in Narrated Articles
text: Five articles from around The Times, narrated just for you.

title: Did My Cat Just Hit On Me? An Adventure in Pet Translation
text: Entrepreneurs are aiming to put A.I.-powered pet translation tools into our pockets.

title: Your Strangest Pet Names, from ‘Soup’ to ‘Sweet Muffin Breath’
text: A dozen of our readers’ weirdest terms of endearment for and by their loved ones (and their origin stories).

title: Hong Kong will cull thousands of hamsters after Covid cases in a pet shop.
text: Officials said it was not clear that the virus had been transmitted to humans from the animals. But they called on residents to surrender recently imported hamsters.

title: How can I keep my pet cool and safe during a heat wave?
text: Extreme temperatures pose particular dangers to furry friends.
